column4: can someone help, I tried to install ubunto on flash drive and now it wont boot into windows?
you said it wont boot without the usb drive plugged in, thats different
I dont know why it messed with the c drive when I clearly set it to only install on the usb stick
sounds like you need fix the mbr [reinstall windows bootloader]
with the USB stick it boots into windows perfectly and also ubuntu if I choose it
If I remove the stick it says "cannot find grub" or something like that
but .. ?
I dont know, if I r-install windwos, will it work again? or will it keep booting to grub
the problem is brub
ubuntu cant boot without grub
but I dont want to boot into ubuntu
the fcked up thing is even without the USB stick that has ubuntu, it STILL goes into grub"
well usb sticks die
you have a date for its impending death?
no, but the main thing is I wanted to keep ubuntu on the USB only
even if its on the stick?
your usb install will be there .. it just wont boot without grub taking over first
follow what bcbc2 suggested
reintalling windows will probably take MUCH longer than fixing the mbr and adding GRUB to the usb
I could do the shorrter way but it sounds complicated
it isnt.. just let it sink in .. it'll come to you
thats good.. now, go fix the MBR on the hard disk where windows is
do I have to do that in windows?
by using the windows install disk , yes
